title: Stalker Finds Japanese Pop Icon's House By Zooming Into Her Eyes On Instagram post!
text:
Stalker Finds Japanese Pop Icon's House By Zooming Into Her Eyes On Instagram post!

Stalker Finds Japanese Pop Icon's House By Zooming Into Her Eyes On Instagram post!

You might think you look 'bomb' in those high-resolution pictures that you post on social media but for some that's major information there for online predators.

And one Japanese pop icon fell victim to a cyber stalker's diabolical ways.

Twitter

Cyberstalking has been a problem for years, with criminals and perpetrators of domestic violence using clever methods to track their victims.

In this case, Japanese pop icon named Ena Matsuoka was molested outside her home last month after a 'fan' figured out her address from selfies.

The man identified as Hibiki Sato allegedly zoomed into her eyes in images she'd posted online, and then used Google Street View to identify the station that was reflected.

Sato had even approximated the storey Matsuoka lived on based on the windows and the angle of the sunlight in her eyes.

If that's not creepy, we don't know what is!

Source

Sato admitted to the attack after he was arrested on Sept 17 and revealed that he was a huge fan of Matsuoka.

Social media has turned into a huge fodder for online stalkers and with the way people document each and every aspect of their lives on Instagram, Twitter and Facebook, things aren't very difficult.
